title: Honoring Caylie Axtell upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the 2010 New York State Fair Master Guernsey Showman Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Caylie Axtell upon the occasion of her
designation as recipient of the 2010 New York State Fair Master Guernsey
Showman Award

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to act, in accord with
its long-standing traditions, honoring the youth of today,  and  leaders
of  tomorrow, whose character and achievements best exemplify the ideals
and values cherished by this great State and Nation; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor 13
year-old Caylie Axtell upon the occasion of her designation as recipient
of the 2010 New York State Fair Master Guernsey Showman Award at the New
York State Fair; and
  WHEREAS, Caylie Axtell of Deposit, New York, won this auspicious award
for all age groups by competing at the 2010 New York State Fair with her
Guernsey Spring Yearling, Ripley Farms American  Pie  Connie-Queena,  in
both showmanship and confirmation classes; and
  WHEREAS,  The Showmanship contest is based on the ability of the show-
man to present the cow to the judge to the  best  of  her  ability,  the
cleanliness  and fitting of the animal, and the knowledge of the showman
concerning her animal; and
  WHEREAS, Besides the floor sized trophy, Caylie Axtell  was  presented
with  a show halter given in memory of J.D. Ferguson, and received a set
of fitting clippers for her animal; and
  WHEREAS, In confirmation  classes,  Caylie  Axtell's  heifer  won  her
class,  and  went  on  to  win  Junior  Champion of the Junior Show, and
Reserve Junior Champion of the Open Show; this  qualified  her  for  the
National Guernsey Show in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania held on September 20,
2010; and
  WHEREAS, In the National contest, Caylie Axtell placed second with her
animal in the Junior Show, and fourth in the Open Show; and
  WHEREAS, Caylie Axtell also exhibited at the World Dairy Expo in Madi-
son,  Wisconsin  on September 30, 2010, placing third in the Junior Show
and sixth in the Open competition; and
  WHEREAS, A young woman of singular distinction and superlative  abili-
ty,  Caylie  Axtell  has  established  a high standard of excellence and
purposefulness of life rarely achieved in youthful years; and
  WHEREAS, Poised eagerly with enthusiasm and determined purpose, Caylie
Axtell now stands honorably, with just pride in her accomplishments  and
in eager anticipation of future challenges, understanding and appreciat-
ing  the  caring counsel and support provided by her loving parents, Joe
and Christel Axtell, who is also the New York State Guernsey Youth Advi-
sor; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor Caylie Axtell upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of
the  2010  New  York State Fair Master Guernsey Showman Award; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Caylie Axtell, Lumber Road, Deposit, New York.
